dt: {bc}to evaluate, measure, or identify (something or someone) again by means of a {d_link|test|test:1}

dt.t: In English I, 77,623 students who were {wi}retested{/wi} in the spring failed again.
… his team tutored and {wi}retested{/wi} a group of healthy elderly volunteers on whom he'd gathered data for 14 years.
… cats may test negative for some time after they are exposed and should be {wi}retested{/wi} 90 days after possible exposure.
The doctors were {wi}retesting{/wi} him for cystic fibrosis.
… Rhodes has instituted a new policy allowing students to {wi}retest{/wi} at any time, letting them leap forward when they're ready.

utxt.t: He failed and had to return for a {wi}retest{/wi}.
I was happy to hear that, six months later in January, her {wi}retest{/wi} remained normal.

shortdef: to evaluate, measure, or identify (something or someone) again by means of a test
